{{Infobox Vice President | name = José Ramón Machado Ventura | image = | imagesize = | order = [[Secretary of the Communist Party of Cuba|Second Secretary of the Communist Party of Cuba]] | term_start = 19 April 2011 | term_end = | leader = Raúl Castro | predecessor = [[Raúl Castro]] | order2 = 2nd [[First Vice President of Cuba]] | term_start2 = 24 February 2008 | term_end2 = 24 February 2013 | president2 = Raúl Castro | predecessor2 = [[Raúl Castro]] | successor2 = [[Miguel Díaz-Canel Bermúdez]] | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1930|10|26|df=y}} | birth_place = [[San Antonio de las Vueltas]], [[Cuba]] | death_date = | death_place = | spouse = | party = [[Communist Party of Cuba]] | profession = [[Physician]] }} '''José Ramón Machado Ventura''', M.D. (born 26 October 1930) is a Cuban revolutionary and politician who was the [[Vice President of Cuba|First Vice President]] of the [[Council of State of Cuba]] from 2008 to 2013. With the election of [[Raúl Castro]] as [[President of Cuba]] on 24 February 2008, Machado was elected to succeed him as First Vice President.<ref name=reuters>{{cite news|title=Factbox: Facts about Cuba's new No.2, Machado Ventura|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2008/02/24/us-cuba-castro-machado-idUSN2410348220080224|accessdate=8 January 2014|newspaper=Reuters|date=24 February 2008}}</ref> He has been [[Secretary of the Communist Party of Cuba|Second Secretary of the Communist Party of Cuba]] since 2011.
==Biography== ===Early life=== José Ramón Machado was born in [[San Antonio de las Vueltas]], in the former province of [[Las Villas (Cuba)|Las Villas]], and was schooled in [[Camajuaní]] and [[Remedios, Cuba|Remedios]].<ref name=gadcuba>{{cite web|title=Los Culpables de Cuba: La Elite de Poder (Cuba's Guilty: The Powerful Elite)|url=http://gadcuba.org/Los%20Culpables/Elite%20del%20Poder.htm|publisher=Gadcuba.org|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040921194121/http://gadcuba.org/Los%20Culpables/Elite%20del%20Poder.htm|archivedate=2004-09-21 |language=Spanish}}</ref> He is a medical doctor by profession, graduating from the [[University of Havana]] in 1953. Machado joined the [[Cuban Revolution|revolutionary movement]] immediately following [[Fulgencio Batista]]'s [[coup d'état]] of 10 March 1952, while still a medical student, and was an early member of the [[26th of July Movement]] opposing the dictatorship. Later, under the command first of [[Che Guevara|Ernesto "Che" Guevara]] and subsequently of [[Fidel Castro]], he was one the original revolutionaries who fought the guerrilla war in the [[Sierra Maestra]]. In 1958, promoted to the rank of captain, he was sent to the province of [[Oriente Province|Oriente]] under the command of Raúl Castro as part of the rebels' bid to open up a second front. There he was placed in charge of the guerrillas' medical service, establishing a network of hospitals and dispensaries, and was promoted to the rank of major "''comandante''" (top rank on Castro's rebel army).<ref name=reuters/><ref>{{cite web|title=Elegido José Ramón Machado Ventura primer vicepresidente cubano (José Ramón Machado Ventura Chosen as First Cuban Vice President)|url=http://www.prensalatina.com.mx/article.asp?ID=%7B057B757E-6425-4EAE-9357-2773D79E44D1%7D|publisher=Prensa Latina|language=Spanish}}{{dead link|date=September 2016|bot=medic}}{{cbignore|bot=medic}}</ref>
===After the Cuban Revolution=== Following the revolutionaries' victory on 1 January 1959, he was appointed the director of medical services in Havana and later served as the national [[Minister of Health]] from 1960 to 1967, during which time he was responsible for the development of the country's [[Health care in Cuba|health sector]].<ref name=gadcuba/> In January 1968, reportedly in the aftermath of a personal conflict with Fidel Castro over the running of the health sector,<ref name=gadcuba/> he was appointed to serve as the [[Politburo]]'s delegate in the province of [[Matanzas]]. He remained in Matanzas until mid-1971; his administration of the province's economy and health sector was successful, particularly in terms of crop outputs, public transport and reduced infant mortality.<ref name=gadcuba/> Upon leaving Matanzas in 1971, he was appointed first secretary of the [[Cuban Communist Party]] in the [[Havana Province|province of Havana]] and was elected to the Politburo in December 1975.
He is a member of the [[National Assembly of People's Power]], representing the municipality of [[Guantánamo]]. Since 2006, he has been responsible for overseeing Cuba's international education programs.<ref name=reuters/>
José Ramón Machado has been described as "a hardline communist ideologue and old guard revolutionary."<ref name=reuters/>
On 10 January 2007, he represented Cuba at the inauguration of [[Nicaragua]]n President [[Daniel Ortega]].<ref name=reuters/>
Machado was elected by the National Assembly of People's Power as First Vice-President of the Council of State on 24 February 2008, at the same time as Raúl Castro's election as President;<ref name=State>{{cite web|title=Results of Council of State elections|url=http://granma.cu/ingles/2008/febrero/vier29/09vota-i.html|publisher=Granma International|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080917140744/http://granma.cu/ingles/2008/febrero/vier29/09vota-i.html|archivedate=17 September 2008|date=29 February 2008|location=Havana}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Raul Castro named Cuban president|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/americas/2008/02/2008525185752256952.html|accessdate=8 January 2014|newspaper=Al Jazeera|date=February 25, 2008}}</ref> he received 601 out of 609 votes.<ref name=State/>

{{Infobox Governor General | honorific-prefix= [[Don (honorific)|Don]] | name=José de Armendáriz | honorific-suffix=Marqués de Castelfuerte
[[Order of the Golden Fleece|Caballero del Toisón de Oro]]
[[Order of Santiago|Caballero de Santiago]] | image=José de Armendáriz2.jpg | order=28th [[List of Viceroys of Peru|Viceroy of Peru]] | term_start=May 14, 1724 | term_end=February 4, 1736 | monarch=[[Philip V of Spain|Philip V]] | primeminister= | predecessor=[[Diego Morcillo Rubio de Auñón|Diego Morcillo]] | successor=[[José Antonio de Mendoza, 3rd Marquis of Villagarcía|José Antonio de Mendoza]] | birth_date= | birth_place=[[Ribaforada]], [[Navarre]], [[Spain]] | death_date=c. 1740 | death_place=[[Madrid]], [[Spain]] | spouse= | children= | profession= | signature= | religion=[[Catholic]] |}} '''José de Armendáriz y Perurena, 1st Marquis of Castelfuerte''' (sometimes ''marqués de Castel-Fuerte'') (? in [[Ribaforada]], [[Navarre]] – 1740 in probably in [[Madrid]]) was a Spanish soldier and colonial administrator. From May 14, 1724 to February 4, 1736 he was viceroy of [[Peru]]. ==Early career== He entered the military and fought in the [[War of the Spanish Succession]], on the side of [[Philip V of Spain]]. He saw action in the campaigns in [[Naples]], [[Sardinia]], [[Roussillon|Rosellón]] and [[Catalonia]], and in the siege of [[Gibraltar]]. Philip granted him the title of marquess of Castelfuerte on June 5, 1711. He was governor of [[Tarragona]] and [[Captain General|captain general]] of [[Guipúzcoa]]. He was appointed a member of the [[Order of the Golden Fleece]] in 1737 on his return to Spain, and was also awarded the [[Order of Santiago]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20060812111210/http://www.somosprimos.com/spsep02.htm] ==As viceroy of Peru== In 1723 Philip named him viceroy of Peru, a position which he took up in May of the following year. His term in office was distinguished by a campaign against fraud and corruption in the government, and reform of the royal treasury and tax collection. He took steps to strengthen the ''[[Mita (Inca)|mita]]'', the forced labor of Indigenous in the silver mines, and thus to stimulate the production of the metal. He sent to jail the Count of San Juan de Lurigancho, director of the mint, as well as the assayer, for producing false coins. In order to fight smuggling (especially of silver), he reorganized the navy and fortified the coasts. He reestablished the system whereby Inca nobles who could prove their ancestry were recognized as [[Hidalgo (Spanish nobility)|hijosdalgo]]s of Castile. This led to a frenzy on the part of the Indigenous nobility to legitimate their status. In 1724 society in Lima discovered an exotic drink — coffee. One patron commented, "The new drink is as bitter as the new viceroy". ==The Comunero Revolt in Paraguay== During this time the [[Revolt of the Comuneros (Paraguay)|Comunero Revolt]] broke out in Paraguay. The governor of Paraguay, [[Diego de los Reyes Balmaseda]], was an unpopular supporter of the [[Jesuit]]s. A predecessor of Viceroy Armendáriz, [[Carmine Nicolao Caracciolo]], sent an inspector there in 1721 to look into the matter. The inspector was [[José de Antequera y Castro]]. Antequera, however, gained the support of the comuneros, challenged royal authority, imprisoned Reyes Balmaceda and expelled the [[Jesuit]]s. (The Jesuits were unpopular because they sheltered many Indians from forced labor.) Antequera defeated a royalist force from [[Buenos Aires]] under García Ros. In 1724, Armendáriz, now the viceroy in Lima, ordered Buenos Aires governor [[Bruno Mauricio de Zabala]] to suppress the rebellion and send Antequera to Lima for trial. Antequera's followers deserted him, and he was forced to flee to a convent in Cordóba in March 1725. He was arrested at [[Chuquisaca Department|Chuquisaca]] in Charcas, and taken to Lima. He was eventually brought to trial, and in 1731 he was beheaded. However another revolt broke out in Paraguay in 1730, under [[Fernando Mompó de Zayas]]. Mompó asserted the sovereignty of the people over the king. Armendáriz faced other rebellions as well. The first uprising of the [[Chiriguano]]s, led by Aruma, occurred in 1727. In 1730 there was an insurrection in [[Oropesa, Perú|Oropesa]], led by the Mestizo [[Alejo Calatayud]].[http://perso.wanadoo.es/remilitari/cronolog/hispamerica.htm] ==End of his term== In 1736 Armendáriz turned over the office to his successor, [[José Antonio de Mendoza, 3rd Marquis of Villagarcía]]. The ex-viceroy returned to Spain, became captain of the king's guard, and was elected a [[Knight of the Order of the Golden Fleece]] in 1737. He died in 1740 without descendants. ==External links== *{{es icon}} [http://es.encarta.msn.com/encyclopedia_761592942/Jos%C3%A9_de_Armend%C3%A1riz_marqu%C3%A9s_de_Castelfuerte.html Short biography] ([https://www.webcitation.org/5kws4H6pe?url=http://es.encarta.msn.com/encyclopedia_761592942/Jos%C3%A9_de_Armend%C3%A1riz_marqu%C3%A9s_de_Castelfuerte.html Archived] 2009-10-31) *[http://san.beck.org/11-3-LatinAmerica1580-1763.html About the insurrection in Paraguay] *{{es icon}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20110709181454/http://redalyc.uaemex.mx/redalyc/pdf/126/12631210.pdf His administration] {{s-start}} {{s-gov}} {{succession box | title = [[List of Viceroys of Peru|Viceroy of Peru]] | years = 1724–1736 | before = [[Diego Morcillo Rubio de Auñón|Diego Morcillo]] | after = {{nowrap|[[José Antonio de Mendoza, 3rd Marquis of Villagarcía|José Antonio de Mendoza]]}}}} {{s-end}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Armendariz, Jose de}} [[Category:Year of birth missing]] [[Category:1740 deaths]] [[Category:Marquesses of Spain]] [[Category:Viceroys of Peru]] [[Category:Knights of the Golden Fleece]] [[Category:Knights of Santiago]] [[Category:Basque people]]

Nordia Films | released = 5 December 1974 | runtime = 95 mins | country = {{FRA}} | language = French }} '''''Les Démoniaques''''' (English title: ''Demoniacs'') is a 1974 film directed by [[Jean Rollin]], about a group of shipwrecked sailors who rape two young women, who re-emerge and make a pact with the devil to get their revenge. ==Plot== At the end of the 19th century, on the north European coasts, live three [[Wrecking (shipwreck)|shipwreckers]] simply nicknamed the "wreckers". The Captain is their leader, followed by Le Bosco, Paul and the beautiful but perverted Tina. When two young women accidentally stumble upon these wreckers, they brutally and violently rape them. The next day, the Captain thinks that he is going insane when he sees the women's dead bodies. He wrecks a tavern and gets into a fight with Le Bosco. The Captain, Tina, Le Bosco and Paul go back to the wreck to kill the women, who manage to escape. Wandering around, the women come across a clown who looks after them. The women are unable to speak, but a man tells them he can help them. They communicate via a drawing and the man realises that they want revenge. The women are the only ones who can free the devil from being imprisoned in the ruins of an old castle; by making love to each of them, he will give them the power to get their revenge. The women, now the "démoniaques", return for their revenge. At the beach, they are again attacked by the Captain and Le Bosco, who tie them to the wreck. The Captain goes mad and kills Tina and Le Bosco. He realises that what he has done is wrong, but is unable to save them, and the tide comes in and they all drown. ==Cast== * Joëlle Cœur as Tina * Lieva Lone as Demoniac * Patricia Hermenier as Demoniac * John Rico as The Captain * [[Willy Braque]] as Le Bosco * Paul Bisciglia as Paul * Louise Dhour as Louise * Ben Zimet as The Exorcist * [[Mireille Dargent]] as The Clown * Miletic Zivomir as The Devil * Isabelle Copejans as The Barmaid * Yves Colignon as The Barmaid's Lover * Veronique Fanis as Girl in Tavern * Monika Swinn as Girl in Tavern (credited as Monika) * Jacqueline Priest as Girl in Tavern * Anne Wattican as Girl in Tavern (credited as Anne Watticant) * Jean-Pierre Bouyxou as Sailor in Tavern * Raphaël Marongiu as Sailor with the Dracula puppet (credited as Raphale G. Marongiu) * Sylvio Dieu as Sailor * Gilbert Schnarbach as Sailor in Tavern * Yann as Sailor * Jio Berk as Sailor (uncredited) * Burr Jerger as Satanist Priest on the Beach (uncredited) * Jean-Jacques Renon as Travestite (uncredited) ==Home media== ''Les Démoniaques'' was released on [[DVD]] in the US on 21 September 1999 by [[Image Entertainment]], with an aspect ratio of 1.64:1. It was released in the UK on 27 September 2004 by [[Redemption Films]] with an aspect ratio of 1.64:1 and special features including the theatrical trailer, a stills gallery and a Rollin filmography. <!--Please do NOT include names of people who do not have an article on Wikipedia--> [[File:Hincks - William Shipley.jpg|thumb|upright|[[William Shipley]], founder of the Society in 1754.]]
Below is a partial '''list of Fellows of the [[Royal Society of Arts]]''' (formally, the Royal Society for the Encouragement of Arts, Manufactures and Commerce).<ref name=fellowshiproot>{{cite web|url=http://www.thersa.org/fellowship|title=Fellowship|accessdate=25 October 2016|publisher=[[Royal Society of Arts]], London, UK}}</ref> A [[Fellow of the Royal Society of Arts]] is entitled to use the [[post-nominal letters]] '''FRSA''' after his or her name.<ref name=fellowshipcharter>{{cite web|url=https://www.thersa.org/about-us/governance/bye-laws-and-charter|title=Post-Nominal Letters|accessdate=9 March 2018|publisher=[[Royal Society of Arts]]|year=2016}}</ref>
==Fellowship== Admission to the Fellowship is by nomination or application (reviewed by a formal admissions panel).<ref name="fellowship">[https://www.thersa.org/fellowship/apply-for-fellowship/ Join the Fellowship - RSA], Royal Society of Arts. Retrieved 10 December 2015.</ref> All fellows to be elected to the Fellowship have to demonstrate achievement or potential related to the arts, manufactures and commerce. The RSA Fellowship is an international community of 29,000 (since its founding in 1754) achievers and influencers ({{asof|2017|lc=y}})<ref name=fellowshiproot/> from a wide array of backgrounds and professions, who are distinguished by the letters FRSA.
Fellows include social entrepreneurs, scientists, community leaders, commercial innovators, artists, journalists, architects, engineers, and many other occupations.<ref name="fellowship" />
[[Charles Dickens]], [[Adam Smith]], [[Benjamin Franklin]], [[Karl Marx]], [[Richard Attenborough]], [[William Hogarth]], [[John Diefenbaker]], [[Stephen Hawking]], [[Benson Taylor]] and [[Tim Berners-Lee]] are some of the notable past and present Fellows, and today it has [[Fellows of the Royal Society of Arts|Fellows]] elected from 80 countries worldwide.
Major physical meetings of Fellows are held at [[Royal Society of Arts#The RSA Building|RSA House]], an 18th-century property in [[London]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thersa.org/venue-hire/the-house |title=RSA — The House |accessdate=4 June 2013 |publisher=[[Royal Society of Arts]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130530155058/http://www.thersa.org/venue-hire/the-house |archivedate=30 May 2013 |df= }}</ref> Regional meetings also take place. The RSA Fellowship maintains a collaborative online presence through the Fellowship's proprietary social network.

'''Marc de Hemptinne''' ([[Ghent]], 1902-1986) was a [[Belgium|Belgian]] physicist. He was the son of [[Alexandre de Hemptinne]], a professor at the [[Catholic University of Leuven (1834–1968)|University of Leuven]]. He studied chemistry at the [[University of Ghent]] and obtained a PhD in Science in 1926. Marc de Hemptinne was a pioneer of molecular [[spectroscopy]]. In 1948 he was awarded the [[Francqui Prize]] on Exact Sciences.
==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060103111623/http://www.phys.ucl.ac.be/Marc_de_HEMPTINNE.pdf Marc de Hemptinne] (in French)

Victoria Nkinzi
Joan Tebatagwabwe Nassolo
Sarah Katrina Ssangalyambogo
Richard Ssemakookiro |}} '''Ronald Edward Frederick Kimera Muwenda Mutebi II''' (born 13 April 1955) is the reigning [[Kabaka of Buganda|Kabaka]] (also known as king) of the [[Buganda|Kingdom of Buganda]], a constitutional kingdom in modern-day [[Uganda]]. He is the 36th ''Kabaka'' of Buganda. ==Claim to the throne== He was born at the [[Mulago Hospital]], [[Kampala]].[http://www.royalark.net/Uganda/buganda9.htm "The Abalasangeye Dynasty"], Royal Ark. He is the son of [[Mutesa II of Buganda|Edward Frederick William David Walugembe Mutebi Luwangula Muteesa II]], ''Kabaka'' of Buganda, who reigned between 1939 and 1969. His mother was ''Nabakyala'' Sarah Nalule, Omuzaana Kabejja, of the Nkima clan. [[File:Muwenda Mutebi II, Ireland, 1966.jpg|thumb|right|Muwenda Mutebi II, Ireland, 1966]] He was educated at Budo Junior School, King's Mead School in [[Sussex]] and [[Bradfield College]], a public school in [[West Berkshire]]. He then entered [[Magdalene College, Cambridge]], where he read social anthropology and law but was [[Rustication (academia)|rusticated]] before he earned a degree.{{cite news |last=Dennis |first=Ferdinand |authorlink=Ferdinand Dennis|title=The King and I | url=https://www.theguardian.com/theguardian/2001/oct/06/weekend7.weekend5 | accessdate=8 April 2014 | newspaper=[[The Guardian]] | date=6 October 2001}} At the age of 11, he was appointed as Heir Apparent by his father on 6 August 1966. While in exile with his father, he reportedly worked as a double-glazing salesman in the [[United Kingdom]],{{cite web | url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/africaandindianocean/uganda/1396120/Idi-Amins-island-of-slaughter-for-sale.html | title=Idi Amin's Island of Slaughter For Sale | accessdate=7 October 2014 | date=2 June 2002 | first=Telelegraph | last=The | newspaper=[[The Sunday Telegraph]]}} and as a journalist, was Associate Editor of the magazine ''African Concord'' and a member of the Executive Committee of the [[African National Congress]] (ANC) in London. On 21 November 1969, upon the death of his father, he succeeded as the Head of the Royal House of Buganda. He returned to Uganda in 1988, following the removal of the [[Milton Obote|Obote II]] regime and the military junta that briefly replaced Obote II. He was proclaimed at [[Buddo]] on 24 July 1993 upon the restoration of the Ugandan Kingdoms. On 31 July 1993, he was crowned at Buddo. He assumed the style of "His Majesty". He maintains his capital at [[Mengo, Uganda|Mengo]]. ==Married life== Kabaka Ronald Muwenda Mutebi II is married to one wife, whom he wed on 27 August 1999. The official title of the Kabaka's wife is the Nnabagereka. Her full name and title is [[Sylvia Nagginda]], the [[Nnabagereka of Buganda|Nnabagereka]], daughter of John Mulumba Luswaata of Nkumba, Kyaddondo, a member of the Omusu clan and Rebecca Nakintu Musoke who currently lives in New York. She is the granddaughter of George William Musoke and Nora Musoke of Nazzigo, Kyaggwe; and Omutaka Nelson Nkalubo Sebugwawo and Catherine Sebugwawo of Nkumba. The royal wedding was held at [[Namirembe Cathedral|Saint Paul's Cathedral Namirembe]], in Kampala, on 27 August 1999.{{cite web | url=https://www.theguardian.com/theguardian/1999/aug/27/features11.g28 | title=Pearly King | first=Guardian | last=The | accessdate=7 October 2014 | date=27 August 1999 | newspaper=[[The Guardian]]}} Together, they have one daughter, Sarah Katrina Mirembe Ssangalyambogo Nachwa, born on 4 July 2001 in [[London]], United Kingdom.{{citation needed|date=February 2016}} ==Children== The children of Kabaka Ronald Muwenda Mutebi II include the following:{{cite web|accessdate=7 October 2014|date=| url=http://www.royalark.net/Uganda/buganda9.htm|title=The Children of Kabaka Muwenda Mutebi II|publisher=Royalark.net}} ('''1''') Prince (Kiweewa) Jjunju Suuna, whose mother is Vénantie Sebudandi. He was born in London, United Kingdom, in 1986. He attended [[King's College, Budo]], before moving to [[England]] for further studies. ('''2''') Princess (Omumbejja) Joan Nassolo. ('''3''') Princess (Omumbejja) Victoria Nkinzi. ('''4''') Princess (Omumbejja) Katrina Sarah Kirabo Ssangalyambogo. She was born in London, UK, on 4 July 2001. She attends private school in Kampala, Uganda. She is an excellent swimmer and has won awards at competitions in [[East Africa]], within her age group.{{cite web|title=Ssangalyambogo Named On Team for CANA| url=http://www.newvision.co.ug/news/653367-ssangalyambogo-named-on-team-for-cana.html|date=10 March 2014|accessdate=7 October 2014| first=Michael|last=Nsubuga|newspaper=[[New Vision]]|location=Kampala}} ('''5''') Prince (Omulangira) Richard Ssemakookiro, born in July 2011. On 17 January 2012 the Katikkiro (Prime Minister) of Buganda Kingdom at that time, ''Engineer John Baptist Walusimbi'', confirmed that Prince Ssemakookiro′s mother is a Muganda lady from the Enseenene (Grasshopper) clan. Later, the prince's mother was revealed as Rose Nansikombi, who hails from [[Luweero District]] in Buganda (Central Uganda).{{cite web|first=Edward|last=Sserinya|location=Kampala| url=http://www.newvision.co.ug/news/628539-buganda-prince-mother-revealed.html|title=Buganda Prince's Mother Revealed|date=23 January 2012|accessdate=7 October 2014|newspaper=New Vision}} ==Other responsibilities== On 15 April 2011, he was installed as the first chancellor of [[Muteesa I Royal University]]. The university was founded in 2007 and named in memory of [[Muteesa I of Buganda]], in recognition of his foresight in promoting education in Buganda and Uganda and of his superior diplomatic skills in juggling the influences of the British, the French, and the Arabs in the late 1800s.{{cite web|accessdate=7 October 2014|newspaper=New Vision|location=Kampala|url=http://www.newvision.co.ug/D/8/13/752588|title=1,000 Graduate From Muteesa University|date=19 April 2011|first=Ali|last=Mambule|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140908113055/http://www.newvision.co.ug/D/8/13/752588|archivedate=8 September 2014|df=}} As the head of the Buganda kingdom, he owns Nkuluze Trust, which runs the following kingdom properties: Buganda Land Board, which is responsible for kingdom land and other land matters, K2 Telecom, which is a telecommunication company, BBS Television, which is a kingdom TV, CBS FM, Majestic Brands, which deals in selling royal products, Ngule beer in collaboration with Uganda Breweries Ltd, Muganzirwazza Plaza, a commercial building in Katwe, a suburb of the Ugandan capital Kampala, Masengere building another building, which also houses Kingdom Television. ==Patronages== {{BLP unsourced section|date=February 2016}} * Patron and Chief of the Trustee Buganda Cultural and Development Foundation [BUCADEF] (since 1996). * Patron of the Kabaka Foundation. * Patron of the Buganda Development Agency (BDA). * Patron of the Monkton Foundation. * Chairman of Rexba Ltd. ==Honours== ; National honours * Sovereign of the Order of the Shield and Spears.{{citation needed|date=February 2016}} Cultural honours: The peaceful lion, the Ssabalongo (head of twin parents), hammered legs (magulu nyondo) == Ancestry == {{ahnentafel |collapsed=yes |align=center |boxstyle_1=background-color: #fcc; |boxstyle_2=background-color: #fb9; |boxstyle_3=background-color: #ffc; |boxstyle_4=background-color: #bfc; |boxstyle_5=background-color: #9fe; |1= 1. {{short description|comedian, writer and producer}} {{Infobox person | name = Neil Campbell | image = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = | ethnicity = | nationality = | education = | alma_mater = University of Iowa | occupation = Comedian, writer, producer | years_active = 2005–present | spouse = | domestic_partner = | children = | parents = | salary = | signature = | website = }} '''Neil Campbell''' is a comedian, writer, and producer, who served as artistic director of the [[Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre]] in Los Angeles, CA from 2008 to 2012. Campbell has worked as a producer and writer on shows including ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang! (TV series)|Comedy Bang! Bang!]]'' and ''[[Brooklyn Nine-Nine]]''.
== Early life == Campbell attended the [[University of Iowa]], where he met frequent collaborator, [[Paul Rust]].<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=https://guestofaguest.com/los-angeles/la-interviews/interview-with-neil-campbell-the-ubright-citizens-brigade-theatres-reigning-artistic-director|title=Interview With Neil Campbell, The Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre's Reigning Artistic Director|work=Guest of a Guest|access-date=2018-10-04|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/comedy-bang-bang-500-episode-milestone-funniest-podcast-scott-aukerman|title=An Oral History of the Funniest Podcast Ever|last=Wilstein|first=Matt|date=2017-07-24|work=The Daily Beast|access-date=2018-10-04|language=en}}</ref>
==Career== Campbell has written and performed at the Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre in Los Angeles, CA since it opened in 2005, and served as artistic director from 2008 to 2012.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" /> Campbell often performed with actor Paul Rust at the Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre, including co-hosting the long-running ''Not Too Shabby'' open-mic sketch show.<ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=https://www.laweekly.com/arts/the-most-memorable-moments-in-ucbs-10-years-in-la-5726539|title=The Most Memorable Moments in UCB's 10 Years in L.A.|last=D'Alessandro|first=Anthony|date=2015-06-26|work=L.A. Weekly|access-date=2018-10-04}}</ref>
Campbell served as an executive producer, writer, and actor on IFC's ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang! (TV series)|Comedy Bang! Bang!]]''<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://deadline.com/2016/08/comedy-bang-bang-canceled-to-end-five-seasons-ifc-1201805539/|title=‘Comedy Bang! Bang!’ To End After Five Seasons On IFC|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|date=2016-08-18|work=Deadline|access-date=2018-10-04|language=en-US}}</ref> Campbell wrote for the [[2015 Emmy Awards]] with the entire ''Comedy Bang! Bang!'' writing staff.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://flavorwire.com/528858/scott-aukerman-is-writing-the-2015-emmys-with-the-entire-comedy-bang-bang-staff|title=Scott Aukerman Is Writing the 2015 Emmys with the Entire ‘Comedy Bang! Bang!’ Staff|date=2015-07-20|work=Flavorwire|access-date=2018-10-04|language=en-US}}</ref> Campbell has been a supervising producer on ''[[Brooklyn Nine-Nine]]'' since 2017.<ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2094206/|title=Neil Campbell|website=IMDb|access-date=2018-10-04}}</ref> He also had a recurring role on the [[Netflix]] show [[Love (TV series)|''Love'']] as Kyle.<ref name=":2" />

{{Infobox person | name = Paul Andrew Kimball | image = <!--Canadian_filmmaker_Paul_Kimball.jpg--> | image_size = | alt = | caption = | education = {{unbulleted list|[[Dalhousie University]] <small>([[Juris Doctor]])</small>| [[Acadia University]] <small>([[B.A.]])</small>}} | alma_mater = | occupation = Filmmaker, author | television = Haunted (Eastlink TV) | party = [[Progressive Conservative Association of Nova Scotia]] | website = [http://www.paulandrewkimball.com paulandrewkimball.com] }}
'''Paul Andrew Kimball''' (born January 2, 1967) is a Canadian film and television producer, writer and director, and politician, who resides in [[Halifax, Nova Scotia]]. Kimball's projects include several [[documentary film]]s about [[UFOs]].
== Education == Kimball graduated as a University Scholar from [[Acadia University]] in 1989 with an Honors degree in history and political science, and then from the [[Schulich School of Law]] at [[Dalhousie University]] in 1992.{{citation needed|date=September 2013}}
==Career== From 1992 until 1997 he worked as a musician and producer in Halifax, founding both Tall Poppies and Julia's Rain.<ref>Campbell, Mark. "Music Takes Top Priority for Tall Poppies Members," in ''Dartmouth Magazine'', September 1992.</ref><ref>Townsend, Trevor. "Addicted to Opium," in ''The SMU Journal'', Vol. 55, No.9. November 3, 1993.</ref><ref>Goodwin, Thom. "Tall Poppies - Fields of Addiction." ''Exclaim Magazine'', May 1994</ref> In 1997, Kimball was employed as a special consultant by Halifax-based film production company Salter Street Films. He then served as the Program Administrator for the Nova Scotia Film Development Corporation until May 1999, after which he founded the Halifax-based film and television production company Redstar Films Limited. Kimball has served as the President of the Nova Scotia Film and Television Producers Association, a member of the Nova Scotia Film Advisory Committee, and was a founding member of the Motion Picture Industry Association of Nova Scotia. He has also worked as a consultant on the film and television industry to the governments of [[Prince Edward Island]] and [[Newfoundland and Labrador]].<ref>{{cite web | last = | first = | title =Paul Kimball - Biography | publisher =IMDB | date =| url =https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3531377/bio | accessdate =2013-08-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | last = | first = | title =Atlantic Filmmakers - Paul Kimball | publisher =EastLink TV | year =2010| url =http://vimeo.com/20353404 | accessdate =2013-08-27}}</ref>
===Film and television=== As a film and television producer / writer / director since 1999, Kimball has created over a dozen documentaries on a wide range of subjects for myriad networks, including Space, Bravo, Vision TV, CBC, TVNZ, SCN, Knowledge Network, EastLink TV, UFO TV, and TrueVisions. These include paranormal-themed films such as ''Stanton T. Friedman is Real'' (2002),<ref>Cranston, Marla. "Maritime Mulder Hits Space Channel." ''Halifax Daily News'', June 19, 2002.</ref> ''Fields of Fear'' (2006),<ref>"Filmmaker Kimball shoots Belzil story," ''Halifax Chronicle Herald'', September 14, 2005.</ref> and ''Best Evidence: Top 10 UFO Sightings'' (2007).<ref>{{cite web | last =Lisk | first =Dean | title =The List From Outer Space | publisher =Halifax Daily News | date =October 13, 2006| url =http://www.paradigmresearchgroup.org/Webpages/The%20Daily%20News%20HFX%20Daily%20%20The%20list%20from%20outer%20space.htm | accessdate =2013-08-27}}</ref> In 2008-09, he wrote, directed, produced and hosted the television series ''Ghost Cases'' in Canada for EastLink TV.<ref>{{cite web | last = | first = | title =For the love of a good ghost story | publisher =Halifax News Net | date =October 16, 2009| url =http://www.halifaxnewsnet.ca/Sports/2009-10-16/article-980010/For-the-love-of-a-good-ghost-story/1 | accessdate =2013-08-28}}</ref> He also wrote, produced and directed two seasons of the television series ''The Classical Now'' (2003–2005),<ref>Redwood, David. "Classical Music not just for old, rich people anymore: Bravo show targets new audience," Halifax Daily News, July 17, 2003.</ref> the classical music documentary ''Denise Djokic: Seven Days Seven Nights'' (2003) which featured renowned Canadian cellist [[Denise Djokic]],<ref>http://redstarfilmtv.blogspot.ca/2010/08/denise-djokic-seven-days-seven-nights.html Stephen Pedersen, "Up close and personal with Djokic," ''Halifax Daily News'', March 29, 2003</ref> and the performance film ''Synchronicity'' (2008), all for [[Bravo (Canada)]]. Kimball's first feature film, ''Eternal Kiss'', was released in 2010 and screened at the Atlantic Film Festival.<ref>{{cite web | last =MacDonald | first =Ron Foley | title =Eternal Kiss: World Premiere | publisher =InfoMonkey | date =April 4, 2010 | url =http://halifax.infomonkey.net/nova.scotia.news.events.php?e=world-premiere-of-eternal-kiss | accessdate =2013-08-28 | deadurl =yes | archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20131104063642/http://halifax.infomonkey.net/nova.scotia.news.events.php?e=world-premiere-of-eternal-kiss | archivedate =November 4, 2013 | df = }}</ref> His second feature film, the supernatural thriller ''The Cuckoo and the Clock'', and his third feature ''Roundabout'' were released in 2014. Kimball's fourth feature ''[[imdbtitle:4899552|Exit Thread]]'' was released in 2016.
===Theater=== In 2007 Kimball adapted and directed a version of the [[Peter Weiss]] play ''Marat / Sade''.<ref>{{cite web | last =MacDonald | first =Ron Foley | title =A 21st Century Marat | publisher =InfoMonkey | year =2007 | url =http://halifax.infomonkey.net/nova.scotia.news.events.php?e=theatre-de-boheme | accessdate =2013-08-27 | deadurl =yes | archiveurl =https://web.archive.org/web/20131104064815/http://halifax.infomonkey.net/nova.scotia.news.events.php?e=theatre-de-boheme | archivedate =2013-11-04 | df = }}</ref> Kimball followed ''Marat / Sade'' later in the year with the science fiction play ''Doing Time'', which he co-wrote with American author [[Mac Tonnies]].<ref>{{cite web | last =Walker | first =Rob | title =Cyberspace When You're Dead | publisher =New York Times Magazine | year =2011| url =https://www.nytimes.com/2011/01/09/magazine/09Immortality-t.html?pagewanted=all&_r=0 | accessdate =2013-08-27}}</ref> It premiered in November in Halifax, Nova Scotia to positive reviews.<ref>{{cite web | last =MacDonald | first =Ron Foley | title =Doing Time A Breath Of Fresh Air| publisher =InfoMonkey | year =2007| url =http://halifax.infomonkey.net/blog.details.php?post_id=1491 | accessdate =2013-08-27}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | last =Watson | first =Kate | title =Make Time For A Great Play| publisher =The Coast | year =2007| url =http://redstarfilms.blogspot.ca/2007/11/doing-time-coast-review.html | accessdate =2013-08-27}}</ref> Kimball also directed ''Doing Time'' at the 2008 Boulder International Fringe Festival.<ref>{{cite web | last = | first = | title =Doing Time | publisher =Boulder International Fringe Festival | year =2008| url =http://www.boulderfringe.com/programs/2008/theater-2008/semaphore-theatre-company/ | accessdate =2013-08-27}}</ref>
===Politics=== In June 2016, Kimball announced he was attempting to enter provincial politics by seeking the [[Progressive Conservative Association of Nova Scotia|Progressive Conservative]] nomination in the riding of [[Halifax Needham]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://thechronicleherald.ca/novascotia/1376539-ex-rcmp-filmmaker-seek-tory-nomination|title=Ex-RCMP, filmmaker seek Tory nomination|work=The Chronicle Herald|date=June 29, 2016|accessdate=2016-06-30}}</ref> In July 2016, he lost the nomination, finishing third on the first ballot.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://thechronicleherald.ca/metro/1381987-arsenault-wins-tory-nod-for-halifax-needham|title=Arsenault wins Tory nod for Halifax Needham|work=The Chronicle Herald|date=July 20, 2016|accessdate=2016-07-29}}</ref> In October 2016, Kimball was nominated as the Progressive Conservative candidate in [[Clayton Park West]] for the [[Nova Scotia general election, 2017|2017 general election]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://thechronicleherald.ca/novascotia/1405880-filmmaker-picked-by-pcs-takes-aim-at-liberals|title=Filmmaker picked by PCs, takes aim at Liberals|work=The Chronicle Herald|date=October 14, 2016|accessdate=2016-10-14}}</ref> On election night, Kimball finished second with 26% of the vote to Liberal candidate [[Rafah DiCostanzo]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/nova-scotia/election-elected-mla-riding-electoral-district-halifax-1.4135129|title=Who won in your riding? See the list of elected MLAs|publisher=CBC News|date=May 30, 2017|accessdate=2017-05-31}}</ref>
==Paranormal research== A number of Kimball's documentaries have dealt with [[paranormal]] themes, including the UFO phenomenon, [[ghosts]], and [[cryptozoology]]. Since 2005 he has maintained a blog about various paranormal subjects called The Other Side of Truth.<ref>{{cite web | last = | first = | title =The Other Side of Truth blog | publisher =Paul Kimball | date =| url =http://redstarfilms.blogspot.com | accessdate =2013-08-27}}</ref> His first book, ''The Other Side of Truth: The Paranormal, The Art of the Imagination, and The Human Condition'', was published in October 2012, by Redstar Books.<ref>{{cite web | last =Kimball | first =Paul | title =The Other Side of Truth: The Paranormal, The Art of the Imagination, and The Human Condition | publisher =Redstar Books | date =| url =https://www.amazon.com/The-Other-Side-Truth-Imagination/dp/0991697502/ | accessdate =2013-08-27}}</ref> Kimball is the nephew of prominent [[ufologist]] [[Stanton Friedman]], but is skeptical of extraterrestrial visitation as an explanation for the UFO phenomenon, and is a vocal critic of the [[Exopolitics]] movement, a stance which has generated controversy among believers in the [[Extraterrestrial hypothesis]].<ref>{{cite web | last =Heath | first =Gord | title =Paul Hellyer and the Politics of Exopolitics | publisher =UFOBC | year =2005| url =http://www.ufobc.ca/Beyond/exopolitics.htm | accessdate =2013-08-27}}</ref>
Kimball posits that the paranormal could be our interaction with an advanced non-human intelligence who may be pulling things out of our own minds and presenting it back to us in ways that we will understand. This accounts for why tales of the paranormal have changed over various eras, from dragons to spaceships. Whoever is presenting these images is trying to appeal to a particular audience in a specific time frame. He theorizes that most paranormal phenomena is a kind of artistic creation by this non-human intelligence. It may be part of a teaching or preparation process, whereby humans are encouraged to move up to the next level of development or think about things in a broader way. He has drawn links between the paranormal and various strands of [[spiritualism]] and [[mysticism]], including the experiences of [[Jakob Böhme]], [[William Blake]] and [[Henry Alline]].<ref>{{cite web | last = | first = | title =Paranormal Interactions | publisher =Coast to Coast AM | date =January 21, 2013| url =http://www.coasttocoastam.com/show/2013/01/21 | accessdate =2013-08-27}}</ref><ref>Kimball, Paul. ''The Other Side of Truth: The Paranormal, The Art of the Imagination, and The Human Condition''. Halifax: Redstar Books, 2012.</ref>
Kimball also hosts a podcast called ''The Other Side of Truth'', where he has interviewed a wide range of people primarily about [[paranormal]]-themed subjects, including UFO researchers [[Kevin Randle]], [[Nick Pope (journalist)|Nick Pope]], and [[Stanton Friedman]], historian and author Aaron John Gulyas, filmmaker [[Paul Davids]], and scientist and consciousness researcher [[Dean Radin]].<ref>{{cite web | last = | first = | title =The Other Side of Truth | publisher =Kimball Media | date =| url =http://redstarfilmtv.com/radio/the-other-side-of-truth-podcast/ | accessdate =2013-08-27}}</ref> Kimball has appeared as a guest on numerous radio programs, including ''[[Coast to Coast AM]]'' with [[George Noory]], Radio Misterioso, and Binnall of America.<ref>{{cite web | last = | first = | title =Paul Kimball - Biography | publisher =Coast to Coast AM | date =| url =http://www.coasttocoastam.com/guest/kimball-paul/6415 | accessdate =2013-08-27}}</ref> He is a former co-host of the syndicated radio program [[The Paracast]].
== Filmography ==
* ''Eternal Kiss'' (2010) - Writer / Director / Producer * ''The Cuckoo in the Clock'' (2014) - Writer / Director / Producer / Editor * ''Roundabout'' (2014) - Writer / Director / Producer / Editor * ''Exit Thread'' (2016) - Writer / Director / Producer / Editor * ''Aliens With Knives'' (2018) - Executive Producer * ''The Last Divide'' (2018) - Executive Producer * ''Creepy Crawling'' (2018) - Executive Producer * ''Shadow In The Mirror'' (2018) - Executive Producer / Editor
== Television == * ''Stanton T. Friedman Is Real!'' (2002) * ''Denise Djokic: Seven Days Seven Nights'' (2003) * ''The Classical Now'' (2004–2005, 26 episodes) * ''Do You Believe in Majic?'' (2004) * ''Aztec: 1948'' (2004) * ''Fields of Fear'' (2006) * ''Best Evidence: Top 10 UFO Sightings'' (2007) * ''Synchronicity'' (2008) * ''Ghost Cases'' (13 episodes, 2009–2010) * ''Haunted'' (26 episodes, 2017-2018) * ''Cinema 902'' (13 episodes, 2017-2018) * ''Stand & Deliver'' (13 episodes, 2018)
== Books == * ''The Other Side of Truth'', October 2012, 250 pages. Halifax: Redstar Books. {{ISBN|978-0-9916975-0-2}}
== Music == * ''Julia's Rain - ''Wonderful Broken Silence'' compilation video (2012) * ''Tall Poppies - All Points In Between'' compilation video (2012)

{{infobox person |image = |image_size = |caption = |birth_name = Prudence Anne Villiers Farrow |birth_date = {{birth date and age|mf=y|1948|01|20}} |birth_place = [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], U.S.[http://www.familytreelegends.com/records/39461 California Births 1905-1995] |nationality = American |occupation = Author, meditation teacher, producer |years_active = |education = |alma_mater = [[University of California, Berkeley]]
[[University of California, Los Angeles]] |residence = [[Seagrove Beach, Florida]] |home_town = [[New York City]] |partner = |spouse = Albert Bruns |children = 3 |parents = [[John Farrow]]
[[Maureen O'Sullivan]] |relations = [[Patrick Villiers Farrow]] (brother)
[[Mia Farrow]] (sister)
[[Tisa Farrow]] (sister) }} '''Prudence Anne Villiers Farrow Bruns''' (born January 20, 1948) is an American author, meditation teacher, and [[film producer]]. She is the daughter of [[film director]] [[John Farrow]] and actress [[Maureen O'Sullivan]] and younger sister of actress [[Mia Farrow]]. She is the subject of the [[The Beatles|Beatles]] song "[[Dear Prudence]]".{{cite web|url=http://www.pophistorydig.com/?tag=beatles-prudence-farrow|title= Dear Prudence, 1967-1968|first=Jack|last=Doyle|publisher=PopHistoryDig.com|date=July 27, 2009|accessdate=May 15, 2010}} ==Early life== Farrow was raised in the [[Catholic]] faith and attended [[convent]] schools. She learned the [[Transcendental Meditation technique]] (TM) in 1966 at [[UCLA]] and next year became interested in [[yoga]], opening a yoga institute at a former church in [[Boston]].{{cite news|title=`Dear Prudence' living, teaching TM in Walton|work=Northwest Florida Daily News|location=Fort Walton Beach, Fla.|date= October 25, 1992|page=1C}}{{cite news |work= The Sydney Morning Herald |date=November 9, 1967 |url= https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=RZUpAAAAIBAJ&sjid=OOcDAAAAIBAJ&pg=1360,2696923&dq=prudence+farrow&hl=en|department=Women's Section |page=8 |title= Art and fashion on show}}{{cite news|title=Girl Defects From Convent|date=October 24, 1967|author=Associated Press|work=Gettysburg Times|page=5|url= https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=q2wmAAAAIBAJ&sjid=lP8FAAAAIBAJ&pg=902,610517&dq=prudence+farrow&hl=en }} In 1968 Farrow, along with her sister Mia and brother Patrick, traveled with [[Maharishi Mahesh Yogi]] from [[New York City|New York]] to [[India]],Gould, Jonathan (2007) Harmony Books, ''Can't Buy Me Love: The Beatles, Britain, and America'', {{ISBN|978-0-307-35337-5}} and then to the Maharishi's ashram in [[Rishikesh]] for a Transcendental Meditation teacher training course."Although the Beatles left the retreat before the course on transcendental meditation was finished, Prudence Farrow, Mike Love of the Beach Boys, and others stayed on and became TM teachers" [[The Beatles at Rishikesh|The Beatles arrived]] shortly thereafter.The Ultimate Beatles Quiz Book, Michael Hockinson, page 128, St. Martins Press, 1990. Farrow was dedicated to practicing the TM technique so she could become a TM teacher. She said: "I would always rush straight back to my room after lectures and meals so I could meditate. [[John Lennon|John]], [[George Harrison|George]] and [[Paul McCartney|Paul]] would all want to sit around jamming and having a good time and I'd be flying into my room. They were all serious about what they were doing, but they just weren't as fanatical as me". She "turned into a near recluse" and "rarely came out" of her cottage.{{cite news|title=NOT TUNED IN: Farrow tells story of `Dear Prudence' Sister meditated 23 hours a day, oblivious to song written for her|first=MICHAEL|last=WARREN|work=Milwaukee Journal Sentinel|date=November 5, 1995|page=8}} Lennon was asked to "contact her and make sure she came out more often to socialize" and he wrote the song "[[Dear Prudence]]". According to Lennon, "She'd been locked in for three weeks and was trying to reach God quicker than anyone else".The American book of the Dead, Oliver Trager, page 90, Simon and Schuster, 1997 ==Career== Farrow taught TM for several decades after her teacher training course in India.Here, There and Everywhere: the 100 best Beatles songs, Stephen J Spignesi, Michael Lewis, page 252 Among those she mentored was comedian [[Andy Kaufman]].{{Cite book| publisher = Delacorte Press| last = Zehme| first = Bill| title = Lost in the funhouse| date = 1999-12-01|page=97}} She returned to India for further instruction from the Maharishi in 1986 and has taught Transcendental Meditation in [[Florida]] since 1970.[http://www.tm.org/local_teachers/northeastflorida.html / NW Florida TM program web site] Later in her life, Farrow earned a BA, an MA, and a PhD from the [[University of California, Berkeley]], where she majored in Asian studies. Her doctoral [[dissertation]] was on [[pulse diagnosis]], titled ''Nadivijnana, the Crest-Jewel of Ayurveda: A Translation of Six Central Texts and an Examination of the Sources, Influences and Development of Indian Pulse-Diagnosis''.{{cite news|title=Seeking the Roots of Thought: Once John Lennon's muse, 'Dear Prudence' now teaches meditation|date=April 3, 2011 |first=TONY |last=SIMMONS |publisher=NewsHerald.com|location=Panama City, Florida|url=http://www.newsherald.com/articles/beach-92347-city-panama.html}} Farrow became an elementary school teacher{{cite news|title=How the real 'Dear Prudence' in John Lennon's song inspired me|first=David|last=Magee|work=Chattanooga Times Free Press|date=October 17, 2009|page=B.1}} and according to her résumé she has held teaching positions or presented at conferences held at the University of California at Berkeley, [[Rutgers University]] and the [[University of Wisconsin]].[http://www.prudencefbruns.com/cv.php / curriculum vitae, Prudence F. Bruns, PhD] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110715125135/http://www.prudencefbruns.com/cv.php |date=2011-07-15 }} Farrow has worked in the theater and film industry{{cite web|last=Bruns|first=Prudence,|url=http://www.prudencefbruns.com/resources/Resume.pdf|title=Resume|date=October 20, 2009|accessdate=May 15, 2010|publisher=prudencefbruns.com|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101008061826/http://www.prudencefbruns.com/resources/Resume.pdf|archivedate=October 8, 2010|df=}} as a [[production assistant]] on ''[[The Muppets Take Manhattan]]'' in 1984 and the [[art department]] coordinator for ''[[The Purple Rose of Cairo]]''. She also "conceived and co-produced" the 1994 film ''[[Widows' Peak]]'', which featured her sister, Mia, in a part originally written for their mother, Maureen O'Sullivan.[https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0268527/ Prudence Farrow - IMDB web site] In 1999, she was one of four producers involved in staging ''[[Up From the Ground (play)|Up From the Ground]]'' at the Westbeth Theatre in [[New York City]]. Farrow became a magazine writer in the 2000s. Using her married name, Prudence Bruns, she has authored articles on Asian studies, world religions, [[ayurveda]], and healthy living.[http://www.prudencefbruns.com/publications.php / Publications by Prudence F. Bruns, PhD] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110715125138/http://www.prudencefbruns.com/publications.php |date=2011-07-15 }} In 2012 Farrow established the non-profit Dear Prudence Foundation to raise funds for a [[documentary film]] of the 2013 [[Kumbh Mela]] festival which is held in India every twelve years.{{cite news|last=Wheeler|first=Deborah|title=For the love of TM: ‘Dear Prudence’ heading to India|url=http://www.thedestinlog.com/news/for-the-love-of-tm-dear-prudence-heading-to-india-1.77703|accessdate=January 26, 2013|newspaper=Destin Log|date=January 11, 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130216212228/http://www.thedestinlog.com/news/for-the-love-of-tm-dear-prudence-heading-to-india-1.77703|archivedate=February 16, 2013|df=}} ==Personal life== Farrow married teacher Albert Morrill Bruns in December 1969'Mia's sister Prudence to wed N.Y. teacher in Delco Rites' Philadelphia Daily News 17 December 1969 p. 5. They have three children and four grandchildren. She was nearing the end of a three-year affair with New York real estate heir [[Robert Durst]] when his wife went missing.{{cite news| author = Charles V. Bagli and Kevin Flynn| title =A Two-Decade Spiral Into Suspicion; Long After Wife Disappears, Heir Vanishes After Texas Murder| quote = More than a decade later, Mr. Durst was dating Prudence Farrow, the subject of the Beatles song ''Dear Prudence,'' when his wife disappeared.| newspaper =[[The New York Times]]| date = October 21, 2001| url =https://www.nytimes.com/2001/10/21/nyregion/two-decade-spiral-into-suspicion-long-after-wife-disappears-heir-vanishes-after.html| accessdate =March 15, 2015}}{{cite news|date=December 4, 2000|volume=54|number=24|title=Resuming the Search|first=Bill|last=Hewitt|work=[[People (magazine)|People]]|url=http://www.people.com/people/archive/article/0,,20133152,00.html}} ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== {{Portal|Biography}} *[http://www.prudencefbruns.com/ Prudence F. Bruns] Home page {{Transcendental Meditation movement}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Farrow, Prudence}} [[Category:1948 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American film producers]] [[Category:American people of Australian descent]] [[Category:American people of Irish descent]] [[Category:Transcendental Meditation practitioners]]

{{Infobox person | name = Pulok Chatterji | image = | image_size = 200px | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth year and age|1952}}<ref name=today/> | birth_place = [[Uttar Pradesh]], [[India]] | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = |title = [[Principal Secretary (India)|Principal Secretary]] to [[Prime Minister of India]] |term =October 3, 2011 - May, 2014 | salary = | networth = }} '''Pulok Chatterji''' (born 1952) is an [[India]]n [[civil servant]] who served as [[Principal Secretary to the Prime Minister of India]], Manmohan Singh, from 2011 to 2014.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.thehindu.com/news/national/article2302287.ece | location=Chennai, India | work=The Hindu | title=Nair appointed advisor to PM, Pulok Chatterji as Principal Secretary | date=28 July 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2011-07-29/india/29829000_1_pmo-ias-officer-joint-secretary | work=The Times Of India | title=Pulok Chatterji is principal secretary to PM, Nair adviser | date=29 July 2011}}</ref> and formerly served as Executive Director to the [[World Bank]] and Joint Secretary at the Prime Minister's Office from 2004 to 2009.<ref>{{cite web | title = Pulok Chatterjee, close Sonia associate, joins PMO as Principal Secy |publisher=Indian Express | url = http://archive.indianexpress.com/news/pulok-chatterjee-close-sonia-associate-joins-pmo-as-principal-secy/855048/ |date=October 3, 2011| accessdate = 2014-05-14}}</ref>
He is a 1974 batch [[Indian Administrative Service]] [[Civil Services of India|officer]] from [[Uttar Pradesh]] cadre.
==Early life and education== His late father had been Chairman of United Commercial Bank. He is an alumnus of [[St. Stephen's College, Delhi]].<ref name=today> {{cite web | title = India Today High and Mighty power list 2013: Top 10 officials - | publisher= India Today | url = http://indiatoday.intoday.in/gallery/india-today-high-and-mighty-power-list-2013-the-official-top-10/1/9134.html |date=2013| accessdate = 2014-05-14}}</ref>
==Career== By 1981, he was aged 32 and Collector of Sultanpur in UP. He moved to the PMO as Deputy Secretary when [[Rajiv Gandhi]] took over as PM in 1985. He worked at the Rajiv Gandhi Foundation and as [[Officer on Special Duty (India)|Officer on Special Duty]] to [[Sonia Gandhi]].<ref>{{cite web | title = Profiles: Pulok Chatterjee | url = http://www.outlookindia.com/article.aspx?234460 |publisher=Outlook|date=April 23, 2007| accessdate = 2014-05-14 }}</ref>
In 2004, when [[United Progressive Alliance]] came to power, he returned to PMO serving as Joint Secretary to Government of India before being promoted as Secretary to Government of India.
In 2012, he was awarded the C.F. Andrews Distinguished Alumni Award by the St. Stephen's College, Delhi.<ref name=today/>
==Controversies and allegations== File notings available with ''[[India Today]]'' show that Pulok Chatterji, a senior official in the PMO in 2007-08, was fully aware of [[A. Raja]]'s dubious decision-making in [[2G spectrum case]]. In this note, Chatterji basically agrees that spectrum can be allotted on payment of normal fees -- the existing usual fee of Rs 1,658 crore -- which is what the nine licensees forked out for a pan-Indian footprint.<ref name="pilokscam">{{cite web |url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/pulok-chatterji-tainted-by-scams/1/148554.html |title=Family Choice: Pulok Chatterji tainted by scams before taking over as principal secretary to PM|author=Sandeep Bamzai |date=19 August 2011 |work=[[India Today]] |publisher= |accessdate=15 October 2011}}</ref>
As Joint Secretary in the PMO, Chatterji wrote a note on December 3, 2004, favouring Kalmadi's appointment citing the host city contract and precedent of the 1982 Asian Games. Chatterji's note said Kalmadi should head the OC, but recommended caveats to address concerns raised by then sports minister Sunil Dutt.<ref name="pilokscam"/>
In 2013, several reports state that he was responsible for tampering of the CBI coalgate report.{{citation needed|date=August 2013}}
==See also== * ''[[The Accidental Prime Minister]]''
==References== {{reflist|2}}
==External links== * [http://www.telegraphindia.com/1110730/jsp/frontpage/story_14309501.jsp PMO set to get a direct line as Chatterji’s access to 10 Janpath to alter power balance] * [Clash of egos: Cab Sec opposes MoS rank for Pulok Chatterji Cabinet Secretary opposes MoS rank for Pulok Chatterji] * [http://www.tehelka.com/story_main50.asp?filename=Ws141011Technology.asp Pulok Chatterji to turn Prime Ministers Office paperless] * [http://www.firstpost.com/politics/new-pmo-man-pulok-oversaw-sonias-sloan-kettering-move-55315.html Pulok Chatterji oversaw Sonia’s Sloan Kettering move]

{{like resume|date=November 2015}} {{Infobox person |name = Robert Mondavi |image = File:Robert_Mondavi_with_Wife.jpg |alt = |caption = Robert Mondavi and his wife Margrit |birth_date = June 18, 1913 |birth_place = [[Virginia, Minnesota]], US |death_date = May 16, 2008 (aged 94) |death_place = [[Yountville, California]], US |other_names = |known_for = Winemaker |children = 3 |spouse = Marjorie Declusin (1937–79)
[[Margrit_Mondavi|Margrit Biever]] (1980-2008) |occupation = Winemaker
Philanthropist |nationality = American |awards = Order of Merit of the Italian Republic (2002),
French Legion of Honour (2005)
California Hall of Fame (2005) }} [[File:Robert Mondavi entrance closeup.jpg|thumb|285px|The entrance of Robert Mondavi Winery.]] '''Robert Gerald Mondavi''' (June 18, 1913 – May 16, 2008{{cite web|last= Laube |first= James, ''Wine Spectator'' |title= Robert Mondavi Dies at Age of 94 |url= http://www.winespectator.com/Wine/Features/0,1197,3817,00.html |date= May 17, 2008 }}) was a leading [[United States|American]] [[vineyard]] operator whose technical improvements and marketing strategies brought worldwide recognition for the [[California wine|wines]] of the [[Napa Valley AVA|Napa Valley]] in [[California]]. From an early period, Mondavi aggressively promoted labeling [[wine]]s [[List of grape varieties|varietally]] rather than generically. This is now the standard for [[New World wines]]. The Robert Mondavi Institute (RMI) for Wine and Food Science at the [[University of California, Davis]] opened in October 2008 in his honor.{{cite news |url=http://news.ucdavis.edu/search/news_detail.lasso?id=8782|title=Robert Mondavi Institute for Wine and Food Science Opens |publisher=[[University of California, Davis]] |date=October 10, 2008}} ==Family history== Robert Mondavi's parents Cesare Mondavi and Rosa Grassi emigrated from [[Sassoferrato]]{{cite web |title= Robert Mondavi, Napa Wine Champion, Dies at 94 |url= https://www.nytimes.com/2008/05/17/business/17mondavi.html?pagewanted=all&_r=0 |date= May 16, 2008 }} in the [[Marche]] region of [[Italy]] and settled in the American city of [[Hibbing, Minnesota|Hibbing]], Minnesota. Robert Gerald Mondavi was born in [[Virginia, Minnesota]]. From Minnesota the Mondavi family moved to [[Lodi, California]], where he attended [[Lodi High School (California)|Lodi High School]]. In Lodi, his father, Cesare, established a successful fruit packing business under the name C. Mondavi and Sons, packing and shipping grapes to the east coast primarily for home winemaking. Mondavi graduated from [[Stanford University]] in 1937 with a degree in economics and business administration. While at Stanford he was a member of the [[Phi Sigma Kappa]] fraternity. In 1943, Mondavi joined his father and brother [[Peter Mondavi|Peter]] after the family acquired the [[Charles Krug]] Winery located in [[St. Helena, California]] from James Moffitt. In 1965, Robert Mondavi left the family winery after a feud with his younger brother [[Peter Mondavi|Peter]] over the business direction of the Krug Winery. Subsequently, Mondavi started his own winery in [[Oakville, California]], and set out to create wines that could compete with fine French wines {{Cite journal | last = Davis | first = Kip | authorlink = | title = Peter Mondavi leads Krug’s 150th anniversary celebration | journal = [[Napa Valley Register]] | volume = | issue = | pages = | publisher = Lee Enterprises, Inc. | location = | date = September 15, 2011 | url = http://napavalleyregister.com/lifestyles/food-and-cooking/wine/peter-mondavi-leads-krug-s-th-anniversary-celebration/article_94d0aed4-e013-11e0-8abb-001cc4c002e0.html | issn = | doi = | id = | accessdate = September 15, 2011}} Today, the Robert Mondavi Winery is located between Oakville and [[Rutherford, California|Rutherford]] (though its corporate headquarters are in nearby [[St. Helena, California|St. Helena]]). In 1966, he founded the Robert Mondavi Winery with his sons Michael and Tim Mondavi in the Napa Valley with the goal of producing wines that would compete with the finest wines from Europe. Michael Mondavi, the eldest, was in charge of the sales and marketing for Robert, while Tim was the winemaker. Robert Mondavi was the first major winery built in Napa Valley in the post-Prohibition era. Part of Mondavi's original vineyard land included the ''To Kalon'' (a Greek term meaning "the beautiful") vineyard originally established by Napa Valley pioneer H.W. Crabb in 1868. The winery bearing Mondavi's name produced high quality wine in the [[California mission]] style. ==Family== In 1937, Mondavi married his high school sweetheart, Marjorie Ellen (Declusin) Mondavi. Together, the couple had three children, Michael, Marcia, and Tim. In the late 1970s their marriage ended in a divorce. In 1980, at the age of 67, he married [[Margrit Mondavi|Margrit (Kellenberger) Biever Mondavi]], a Swiss-born, and multilingual woman who worked at the Robert Mondavi winery.{{cite web|last=Prial|first=Frank|title=Robert Mondavi, Napa Wine Champion, Dies at 94|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2008/05/17/business/17mondavi.html?pagewanted=all|publisher=New York Times|accessdate=20 May 2014}} Robert and Margrit had no children, but together they dedicated a lot of time and money to philanthropic events. ==Wine history== [[File:Mondavi Napa Valley Chardonnay 2005.jpg|thumbnail|right|A wine from the Robert Mondavi Winery, a Napa Valley Chardonnay.]] In 1968, Mondavi made a dry oak–aged [[Sauvignon blanc]], an unpopular variety in California at the time, and labeled it "[[Fumé Blanc]]". The wine was a success and, in time, Fumé Blanc became accepted as a synonym for Sauvignon blanc. Mondavi successfully developed a number of premium wines that earned the respect of connoisseurs and vintners alike. In 1979, he built the Mondavi Woodbridge Winery in Lodi, California developing it into a leader of popular-premium wines. He also entered into a joint venture with [[Philippe de Rothschild|Baron Philippe de Rothschild]] of [[Château Mouton Rothschild]] to create [[Opus One Winery]], and since the 1990s has set up joint ventures with local partners in [[Europe]], [[South America]] and [[Australia]].Julien Lefour, Comment les cépages de tradition française deviennent des vins californiens ?, Communications, n°77, 2005, 16 p. (Edgar Morin Center – EHESS/CNRS). Free downloading sur http://www.persee.fr Interested by his work and his success, in the 1990s Mondavi's story and his wine company became topics for specialists of wine. In the [[Grand European Jury Wine Tasting of 1997]], the Robert Mondavi Chardonnay Reserve was ranked number one. In 2005, Robert Mondavi and his younger brother Peter made wine together for the first time after their feud. Using grapes from both family vineyards, they produced one barrel of cabernet blend, which was sold for $400,000 under the name "Ancora Una Volta" ("Once Again") at the 2005 Napa Valley Auction.Patricia Sullivan, [https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2008/05/16/AR2008051603900.html "Robert Mondavi 94; Noted Vintner Who Raised Qualities of American Wine"], ''[[Washington Post]]'', May 17, 2008, p. B5. Accessed 24 May 2008. All the money earned from the barrel of wine went to charity. ==Legacy== In 2003, Mondavi expressed regret and criticized his sons for the business strategy that emphasized the inexpensive Mondavi lines, Coastal and Woodbridge, over the premium wines, allowing the company name to lose its association with fine wine it held in the past. He said, "We've got to get our image back, and that's going to take time."{{cite news|author=Frank J. Prial | title= With Head Held High, Mondavi, at 90, Faces a Storm |url= https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9506E7D9123AF931A35754C0A9659C8B63&scp=1&sq=mondavi+and+prial&st=nyt |work=[[The New York Times]]| date= July 2, 2003}} In the 2004 documentary film ''[[Mondovino]]'', the Mondavi family featured prominently, in close application to its theme of [[globalization]]. At the time, the Mondavis had recently acquired the Italian "[[cult wine]]" [[Ornellaia]] winery, Tenuta Dell'Ornellaia. [[File:UC Davis Mondavi Center.jpg|thumbnail|right|UC Davis Mondavi Center]] On December 22, 2004, [[Constellation Brands]] acquired the Mondavi winery in a controversial takeover for nearly US$1.36 billion in cash and assumption of debt.{{cite news|accessdate=2007-11-13|work=[[San Francisco Chronicle]]|url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?file=/chronicle/archive/2004/11/04/MNG3A9LLVS1.DTL|title= Legendary California wine company is sold | author=Carol Emert|date=November 4, 2004}} Following the sale of the company, Mondavi partnered with his younger son Tim Mondavi and daughter Marcia Mondavi to make a single wine from a single estate at the highest level. The family partnership Continuum Estate is still run by Robert's son Tim, daughter Marcia and grandchildren Carissa Mondavi, Chiara Mondavi, Carlo Mondavi and Dante Mondavi. In 2001, Robert Mondavi donated $10 million to help with the building cost of the Robert and Margrit Mondavi Center for the Performing Arts building at [[UC Davis]]. The [[Mondavi Center]] was opened on October 3, 2002. Robert also donated $25 million to establish the Robert Mondavi Institute for Wine and Food Science and this opened a new era for UC Davis’s wine and food programs. It was the largest private contribution to UC Davis. The two were founders and major benefactors behind the museum [[Copia (museum)|Copia]], which opened November 2001 in the city of [[Napa, California]]. Robert and Margrit were also founding supporters of the restoration of the 19th-century [[Napa Valley Opera House]] and the [[Oxbow School]], a new art school in Napa that provides grants and instruction to art students in their junior year of high school. They have contributed to the restoration of the [[Lincoln Theatre (Yountville, California)|Lincoln Theatre]] in [[Yountville, California]], and have supported the [[Cantor Arts Center]] at Stanford University in [[Palo Alto, California]]. ==Death== Robert Mondavi died at his Yountville home on May 16, 2008 at the age of 94.{{cite web|last= Lechmere |first= Adam, ''Decanter.com'' |title= 'Colossus' Robert Mondavi dies |url= http://www.decanter.com/wine-news/colossus-robert-mondavi-dies-82224/ |date= May 16, 2008 }}{{Cite journal | last = Hubler | first = Shawn | authorlink = | title = California wine came of age under him Vintner elevated state's wines | journal = [[Los Angeles Times]] | volume = | issue = | pages = | publisher = | location = | date = May 17, 2008 | url = http://articles.latimes.com/2008/may/17/local/me-mondavi17 | issn = | doi = | id = | accessdate = October 9, 2010}}{{Cite journal | last = Carson | first = l. Pierce | authorlink = | title = Winery patriarch dead at 94 Mondavi passes: 'We've lost our leader' | journal = [[Napa Valley Register]] | volume = | issue = | pages = | publisher = Lee Enterprises, Inc. | location = Napa, CA | date = May 16, 2008 | url = http://napavalleyregister.com/news/local/mondavi-passes-we-ve-lost-our-leader/article_1672c002-b281-5cb4-a9b7-f617e2aa4bc9.html | issn = | doi = | id = | accessdate = September 18, 2011}} ==Published works== An autobiography ''Harvests of Joy'' was published in 1998.{{cite book |title= Harvests of Joy: How the Good Life Became Great Business |last= Mondavi |first= Robert |author2=Paul Chutkow |year= 1999 |publisher= Harvest Books |location= New York |isbn= 978-0-15-601056-6 }} ==Awards and honors == Robert Mondavi was selected as the ''[[Decanter (magazine)|Decanter]]'' "Man of the Year" in 1989. He was inducted into the Junior Achievement [[U.S. Business Hall of Fame]] in 1991. In 2000 he was awarded Doctor of Oenology, Honoris Causa, by the Board of Trustees of [[Johnson & Wales University]]. In 2002, he received the [[Order of Merit of the Italian Republic]].{{cite news |last=Intardonato |first= John |date=June 19, 2013 |title=Just remembering Robert Mondavi |url=http://napavalleyregister.com/star/business/just-remembering-robert-mondavi/article_67c9f57c-d8fe-11e2-9df5-0019bb2963f4.html |newspaper=Napa Valley Register}} In 2005, he received the [[Legion of Honour]] from the French government. On December 5, 2007, California Governor [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]] and First Lady [[Maria Shriver]] inducted Mondavi into the [[California Hall of Fame]], located at [[The California Museum for History, Women and the Arts]].[http://www.californiamuseum.org/Exhibits/Hall-of-Fame/inductees.html Mondavi inducted into California Hall of Fame] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080110182937/http://www.californiamuseum.org/Exhibits/Hall-of-Fame/inductees.html|date=January 10, 2008 }}, California Museum. Accessed 2007. He was inducted into the [[Culinary Institute of America]] Vintner's Hall of Fame in 2007.[http://www.ciaprochef.com/winestudies/events/vhf_inductees.html#krugl "Vintners Hall of Fame Inductees," Culinary Institute of America] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006102721/http://www.ciaprochef.com/winestudies/events/vhf_inductees.html |date=2014-10-06 }} The election was based upon ballots from seventy wine journalists. The decision for their election of Mondavi is for contributions to the wine industry of California during his lifetime. Robert Mondavi was awarded the Presidential Gold Medal of the Confrerie de la Chaine des Rotisseurs in December 2006 for his many contributions to the Society. ==See also== {{portal|Wine}} * [[List of wine personalities]] * [[Sena wine]] == Further reading == * {{cite book | url=https://juliaflynnsiler.com/books/the-house-of-mondavi/synopsis/ | title=The House of Mondavi: The Rise and Fall of an American Wine Dynasty | publisher=Gotham | author=Siler, Julia Flynn | authorlink=Julia Flynn Siler | year=2008 | isbn=978-1-59240-259-5}} ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== * [http://www.robertmondavi.com/ Robert Mondavi official site] * [http://www.ghidelli.net/scripophily/napa.html Napa Valley Wine Co.] the story and historical documents re. Charles Krug, Jacob Beringer/Beringer Bros., and Cesare/Robert Mondavi (in German) * [https://archive.is/20130726172338/http://www.lib.ucdavis.edu/dept/specol/manu-collections/manuscripts/index.php?collection=777 Robert G. Mondavi Papers] at [http://www.lib.ucdavis.edu/dept/specol/ Special Collections Dept.], University Library, University of California, Davis * {{FAG|26869979|Robert Gerald Mondavi}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mondavi, Robert}} [[Category:1913 births]] [[Category:2008 deaths]] [[Category:People from Virginia, Minnesota]] [[Category:American winemakers]] [[Category:Wine merchants]] [[Category:Viticulturists]] [[Category:Wineries in Napa Valley]] [[Category:Stanford University alumni]] [[Category:American people of Italian descent]] [[Category:People from Lodi, California]] [[Category:People from Yountville, California]] [[Category:Légion d'honneur recipients]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of Merit of the Italian Republic]] [[Category:American people of Marchesan descent]] [[Category:James Beard Foundation Award winners]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2012}} {{Multiple issues| {{Refimprove|date=February 2017}} {{No footnotes|date=February 2017}} }} '''Roberta Beatrice "Bertha" Boyd''' (16 June 1862 – 10 January 1944), sometimes listed as Roberta Grace, was a [[Canada|Canadian]] lighthouse keeper and [[heroine]] known as the '[[Grace Darling]] of the [[Saint Croix River (Maine – New Brunswick)|St. Croix]]'.
== Early life == Roberta was born on 16 June 1862 to John and Kate Boyd. Her father, John Boyd, was the keeper of the Spruce Point Light near [[St. Stephen, New Brunswick]]. Roberta and her mother would tend the light when her father was away.
==St. Croix River rescue==
On 8 October 1882, Boyd saved two men whose [[sailing boat]] had overturned in the river, and rowed them back to shore. For this action she was awarded a gold watch by the [[Dominion of Canada|Dominion Government]] with the words "In recognition of her humane exertions in saving life in the St. Croix River" inscribed on it; in addition, the [[Department of Marine and Fisheries]] presented her with a new boat with "Roberta Grace Boyd, Grace Darling of the Saint Croix" on the helm.
==Later life==
After her father's death on 15 September 1892,<ref>"John Boyd, keeper of the lower lighthouse, near the Ledge, St. Croix river, died Thursday last week from the effects of a bruise accidentally inflicted while at work with a drawing knife. Mr. Boyd was one of the most reliable pilots in the St. Andrews district and was pilot of steamer 'Stroud' while she ran on the Grand Manan route." (22 September 1892). ''St. Andrews Beacon'' (St. Andrews); </ref> Boyd became keeper of the light. She served as keeper at Spruce Point until at least 1922 (when records were no longer published).
Boyd married Herbert LeRoy Hannah on 18 October 1900 in The Ledge, [[St. Stephens Parish, New Brunswick]].
She died on 10 January 1944.
==Notes== {{reflist}}
